Patient Name: Health Record Only  
Age: 65 years  
Height: 170 cm  
Weight: 85 kg  

Admittance Date: 15 April 2023  
Discharge Date: 18 April 2023  

Presentation: A long-time diabetic patient presented with a foot ulcer exhibiting signs of infection, such as erythema and purulent discharge.

Diagnosis and Procedures: The ulcer was debrided, and a swab was taken for culture and sensitivity analysis. Antibiotic therapy was initiated based on clinical suspicion of infection.

Medications: Ciprofloxacin 500 mg every 12 hours and Metformin 1 g twice daily were continued for diabetes management.

Outcome: Significant improvement was noted in the infection, and instructions were given for wound care and monitoring glucose levels. The patient was discharged with a plan for outpatient follow-up.
